question: Which of the following was the main purpose of appointing the MacDonell Commission by Lord Curzon?
option2: To introduce reformations in famine relief administration
option4: To provide a systematic revenue system
answer: To introduce reformations in famine relief administration
explanation: In the year 1900, Lord Curzon appointed a commission to recommend the necessary steps for efficient working of famine relief administration under Antony Patrick MacDonnell. The report of the commission was submitted in the year 1901.
